eecalcs.voltagedrop

Class VDrop

  • java.lang.Object
    • eecalcs.voltagedrop.VDrop

  • public class VDrop
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods for calculation of the voltage drop across circuits and for calculation of the maximum length of a circuit for a given maximum voltage drop.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      ResultMessages resultMessages
      Container for messages resulting from calculations performed by this class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VDrop(Circuit circuit)
      Constructs a VDrop object for a given circuit object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VDrop

        public VDrop(Circuit circuit)
        Constructs a VDrop object for a given circuit object. The result object will contain a deep copy of the given circuit object.
        Parameters:
        circuit - The existing circuit object.

    • Method Detail

      • setSourceVoltage

        public void setSourceVoltage(double sourceVoltage)
        Sets the value of the voltage at the source of the circuit to this VDrop object.
        Parameters:
        sourceVoltage - The voltage at the source in volts. Default value is 120.

      • setPhases

        public void setPhases(int phases)
        Sets the number of phases of the source voltage.
        Parameters:
        phases - The number of phases. Notice there is no validation for this input. Default value is 1.

      • setLoadCurrent

        public void setLoadCurrent(double loadCurrent)
        Sets the circuit connected load's current.
        Parameters:
        loadCurrent - The current of the load in amperes. Default value is 10. Notice that no validation is performed while setting this value, so the user must check for the presence of errors or warnings after setting any value or obtaining a calculation result.

      • setPowerFactor

        public void setPowerFactor(double powerFactor)
        Sets the power factor of the circuit connected load.
        Parameters:
        powerFactor - The power factor of the load. Should be a number between 0.7 and 1.0 inclusive. Default value is 1. Notice that no validation is performed while setting this value, so the user must check for the presence of errors or warnings after setting any value or obtaining a calculation result.

      • setMaxVoltageDropPercent

        public void setMaxVoltageDropPercent(double maxVoltageDropPercent)
        Sets the maximum allowed voltage drop. This value is used to compute the maximum length of the circuit that would have a voltage drop less or equal to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        maxVoltageDropPercent - The maximum voltage drop in percentage. The default value is 3.

      • getVoltageAtLoadAC

        public double getVoltageAtLoadAC()
        Returns the calculated AC voltage at the load terminals. If the returned value is zero, check this object's ResultMessages object for errors. Notice that even if there are no errors, there could be warnings. The user should always check the ResultMessages object for errors and warnings.
        Returns:
        The calculated AC voltage at the load terminals, in volts.
        See Also:
        ResultMessages, resultMessages

      • getVoltageDropVoltsAC

        public double getVoltageDropVoltsAC()
        Returns the calculated AC voltage drop. This voltage is obtained following the following method: The voltage V at the source is assumed to be at zero degrees (the reference angle). The Impedance Z of the conductors is calculated based on the given conditions (size, metal, conduit type, length, etc). The current I phasor modulus is the connected load's current. The phasor angle is determined by the power factor of the load. The complex voltage Vw (drop) across the circuit is calculated as Vw = Z x I The voltage drop returned is |V|-|Vw|.
        Returns:
        The calculated AC voltage drop in volts.

      • getVoltageDropPercentageAC

        public double getVoltageDropPercentageAC()
        Returns the calculated AC voltage drop in percentage. The percentage is in reference to the voltage at the source.
        Returns:
        The calculated AC voltage drop in percentage.

      • getVoltageAtLoadDC

        public double getVoltageAtLoadDC()
        Returns the calculated DC voltage at the load terminals. If the returned value is zero check this object's ResultMessages object for errors. Notice that even if there are no errors, there could be warnings. The user should always check the ResultMessages object for errors and warnings.
        Returns:
        The calculated DC voltage at the load terminals, in volts.
        See Also:
        ResultMessages, resultMessages

      • getVoltageDropVoltsDC

        public double getVoltageDropVoltsDC()
        Returns the calculated DC voltage drop. This voltage is obtained following the following method: Given the voltage V at the source. The resistance R of the conductors is calculated based on the given conditions (size, metal, length, etc). Given the connected load's current I. The voltage Vw (drop) across the circuit is calculated as Vw = R x I The voltage drop returned is V-Vw.
        Returns:
        The calculated DC voltage drop in volts.

      • getVoltageDropPercentageDC

        public double getVoltageDropPercentageDC()
        Returns the calculated DC voltage drop in percentage. The percentage is in reference to the voltage at the source.
        Returns:
        The calculated DC voltage drop in percentage.

      • getCalculatedSizeAC

        public java.lang.String getCalculatedSizeAC()
        Returns the size of the circuit's conductor whose AC voltage drop (under the given conditions) is less or equals to the given maximum voltage drop. If the returned string is empty the user should check for errors in the ResultMessage object.
        Returns:
        The size of the conductor as defined in Size.
        See Also:
        resultMessages

      • getActualVoltageDropPercentageAC

        public double getActualVoltageDropPercentageAC()
        Returns the actual AC voltage drop for the calculated conductor size, under the given conditions.
        Returns:
        The AC voltage drop in volts, of the calculated conductor.
        See Also:
        getCalculatedSizeAC()

      • getMaxLengthAC

        public double getMaxLengthAC()
        Returns the calculated one way length of the circuit's conductor whose AC voltage drop (under the given conditions) is less or equals to the given maximum voltage drop. If the returned value is zero, the user should check for errors in the ResultMessage object.
        Returns:
        The maximum conductor's length in feet.
        See Also:
        getCalculatedSizeAC()

      • getCalculatedSizeDC

        public PropertySet getCalculatedSizeDC()
        Returns the size of the circuit's conductor whose DC voltage drop (under the given conditions) is less or equals to the given maximum voltage drop. If the returned string is empty the user should check for errors in the ResultMessage object.
        Returns:
        The size of the conductor as defined in Size.
        See Also:
        resultMessages

        Returns:
